intro: Prinos serratus, commonly known as the serrated prinos, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves with serrated edges, and it produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain several seeds. Prinos serratus is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
